SEARCH
Package com.dua3.utility.options

Class Option<T extends @Nullable Object>

java.lang.Object
com.dua3.utility.options.Option<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of value associated with this Option
public class Option<T extends @Nullable Object> extends Object
Represents a command-line or configurable option with various attributes. An Option can define its display name, description, value type, default supplier, associated switches, and the parameters it expects. It can also be a flag, a simple parameter, or a list parameter, depending on its configuration.

  • Constructor Details

    • Option

      protected Option(String displayName, String description, Repetitions repetitions, Class<T> targetType, String[] switches, Function<Object[],T> mapper, Supplier<@Nullable T> defaultSupplier, Consumer<T> handler, List<Param<?>> requiredArgs, List<Param<?>> optionalArgs)
      Constructs an Option with the specified properties. This constructor allows defining an option with various characteristics, including its display name, description, repetitions, target type, switches, value mapping logic, default value supplier, handling behavior, and required/optional arguments.
      Parameters:
      displayName - the human-readable name of the option, typically used for display or documentation
      description - a brief description explaining the purpose or functionality of the option
      repetitions - an instance specifying the minimum and maximum number of times the option can be repeated
      targetType - the expected target type of the option's value
      switches - an array of strings representing the command-line switches or aliases associated with the option
      mapper - a function responsible for mapping the raw input arguments into the target type
      defaultSupplier - a supplier providing the default value for the option; may return null
      handler - a consumer for handling the value passed to the option
      requiredArgs - a list of parameters representing the required arguments for this option
      optionalArgs - a list of parameters representing the optional arguments for this option

  • Method Details

    • createFlag

      public static Option<Boolean> createFlag(String displayName, String description, String firstSwitch, String... moreSwitches)
      Creates an Option representing a flag, which is a boolean option that can either be enabled or disabled. Flags do not have additional parameters and can be specified using one or more switches (e.g., command-line arguments).
      Parameters:
      displayName - the descriptive name of the flag, typically used for documentation purposes
      description - a brief description explaining the purpose or functionality of the flag
      firstSwitch - the primary switch associated with the flag (e.g., "--flag" or "-f")
      moreSwitches - additional switches that can be used as aliases for the flag
      Returns:
      an Option<Boolean> instance configured as a flag

    • createSimpleOption

      public static <T> Option<T> createSimpleOption(String displayName, String description, Param<T> param, Supplier<@Nullable T> defaultSupplier, String firstSwitch, String... moreSwitches)
      Creates an Option representing a customizable and reusable parameter with an associated name, description, and default value.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the parameter value
      Parameters:
      displayName - the human-readable name of the option, typically used for display and documentation
      description - a brief text describing the purpose or functionality of the option
      param - the parameter instance associated with this option
      defaultSupplier - a supplier providing the default value for the option; it can supply null
      firstSwitch - the primary switch associated with the option (e.g., command-line flag or alias)
      moreSwitches - additional switches or aliases for the option
      Returns:
      an Option<T> instance configured with the specified properties

    • createSelectionOption

      public static <T> Option<T> createSelectionOption(String displayName, String description, Class<T> targetType, String argName, List<@Nullable T> allowedValues, Converter<String,@Nullable T> converter, Supplier<@Nullable T> defaultSupplier, String firstSwitch, String... moreSwitches)
      Creates a selection option that associates display attributes, type information, allowed values, a converter for parsing input, and default supplier logic.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the option's selectable values.
      Parameters:
      displayName - The name displayed for the option.
      description - A description providing details about the option.
      targetType - The type of values that the option accepts.
      argName - The name used for the argument associated with this option.
      allowedValues - A list of predefined values that can be selected for this option. Can include null if the list permits nullable values.
      converter - A converter that transforms a string input into the expected type.
      defaultSupplier - A supplier function to provide a default value if no specific value is provided.
      firstSwitch - The first switch string to use for this option (e.g., "--flag").
      moreSwitches - Additional switches that can be used as aliases for the option.
      Returns:
      A configured Option instance encapsulating the provided selection data and behavior.

    • createEnumOption

      public static <E extends Enum<E>> Option<E> createEnumOption(String displayName, String description, Class<E> targetType, String argName, Supplier<@Nullable E> defaultSupplier, String firstSwitch, String... moreSwitches)
      Creates an Option for handling enum-type parameters. This method simplifies the creation and configuration of options that are based on enumerations.
      Type Parameters:
      E - The type of the enum.
      Parameters:
      displayName - The user-facing name of the option.
      description - A description of the option's purpose or usage.
      targetType - The enum class type to which this option corresponds.
      argName - The argument name used to represent the option in a command-line or configuration context.
      defaultSupplier - A supplier that provides the default enum value for this option. Can be null.
      firstSwitch - The primary switch name(s) or flag(s) for the option.
      moreSwitches - Additional switch names or flags that the option can be identified with.
      Returns:
      An Option configured for the specified enum type.

    • getRequiredParameter

      public List<Param<?>> getRequiredParameter()
      Retrieves the list of required parameters associated with this option. The returned list is unmodifiable to ensure that the required parameters cannot be altered.
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable list of required parameters Param<?> for this option

    • getOptionalParameter

      public List<Param<?>> getOptionalParameter()
      Retrieves a list of optional parameters defined for this option. Optional parameters are those that are not required and follow the required parameters in the definition.
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable list of optional Param<?> instances representing the optional arguments for this option

    • getDefault

      public Optional<T> getDefault()
      Retrieves the default value for this Option, if it has been configured. The default value is provided by the associated supplier, which may return null if no default is set.
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the default value if it exists, or an empty Optional if no default value is provided

    • getDefaultString

      public Optional<String> getDefaultString()
      Retrieves the default value of this option as an Optional<String>. If the default value is null, an empty Optional is returned. Otherwise, the default value is formatted into a String and returned as an Optional.
      Returns:
      an Optional<String> containing the formatted default value, or an empty Optional if no default value is set

    • repetitions

      public Repetitions repetitions()
      Retrieves the Repetitions instance associated with this Option.

      The Repetitions object specifies the minimum and maximum number of times this option can be repeated when used.

      Returns:
      the Repetitions instance defining the repetition constraints for this option

    • isRequired

      public boolean isRequired()
      Determines whether this option is mandatory. An option is considered required if the minimum number of repetitions specified by the repetitions field is greater than zero.
      Returns:
      true if the option is required (minimum repetitions > 0), false otherwise

    • getTargetType

      public Class<T> getTargetType()
      Retrieves the target type associated with this option.
      Returns:
      the Class instance representing the target type of the option's value

    • handler

      public Consumer<T> handler()
      Retrieves the handler consumer associated with this option. The handler is responsible for processing the value passed to the option.
      Returns:
      the consumer that handles the option's value

    • map

      public Arguments.Entry<T> map(List<String> args) throws ArgumentsException
      Maps the given list of argument strings to an Arguments.Entry instance.

      This method validates the number of arguments against the expected range, processes each argument using the associated parameter's converter, and creates an entry after applying the mapper function. If the arguments cannot be converted or an instance fails to be created, appropriate exceptions are thrown.

      Parameters:
      args - the list of strings representing the arguments to be mapped; the size of the list must match the expected range of arguments for the option
      Returns:
      an Arguments.Entry instance constructed using the mapped argument values and the associated mapper
      Throws:
      AssertionError - if the number of arguments is not within the expected range
      OptionException - if any argument fails to convert to its target type
      IllegalStateException - if an instance of the target type cannot be created
      ArgumentsException

    • displayName

      public String displayName()
      Retrieves the display name of this option. The display name is a human-readable, descriptive name typically used for documentation and display purposes.
      Returns:
      the display name of the option as a String

    • params

      public List<Param<?>> params()
      Retrieves the list of parameters associated with this Option. The parameters define the characteristics and expected input for the option.
      Returns:
      a list of Param<?> instances representing the parameters for this option

    • switches

      public List<String> switches()
      Retrieves the list of switches associated with this option. Switches are command-line arguments or aliases that can be used to invoke or configure the option.
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable list of switches as strings for this option

    • minArgs

      public int minArgs()
      Computes and returns the minimum number of arguments required based on the parameters provided.
      Returns:
      the minimum number of arguments required; returns 0 if there are no parameters

    • maxArgs

      public int maxArgs()
      Computes the maximum number of arguments by summing up the maximum repetitions of arguments across all parameters. If there are no parameters, it returns 0.
      Returns:
      the computed maximum number of arguments, constrained by Integer.MAX_VALUE

    • description

      public String description()
      Retrieves the description of this option.
      Returns:
      the description of the option as a String

    • format

      public String format(T v)
      Formats the given value into its string representation. This method uses String.valueOf() for conversion.
      Parameters:
      v - the value to be formatted; may be null
      Returns:
      the string representation of the given value

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object o)
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Overrides:
      hashCode in class Object

    • isEquivalent

      public final boolean isEquivalent(@Nullable Option<?> other)
      Determines if this option is equivalent to the provided option. Two options are considered equivalent if they have the same target type and their associated names are identical.
      Parameters:
      other - the option to compare this option against; may be null
      Returns:
      true if the options are equivalent, false otherwise

    • isFlag

      public boolean isFlag()
      Determines if the current configuration can be considered as a flag.

      A configuration qualifies as a flag if the target type is Boolean, the allowed number of repetitions is ZERO_OR_ONE, and the maximum number of arguments is zero.

      Returns:
      true if the configuration is a flag; false otherwise

    • hasAllowedValues

      public boolean hasAllowedValues()
      Determines if the current object has allowed values based on its arguments and parameters.

      If an option has allowed values, a list of possible values is assigned to the option and only values contained within that list may be used.

      Returns:
      true if the object has exactly one minimum argument, one maximum argument, and the first parameter of the object has allowed values; false otherwise.

    • allowedValues

      public List<T> allowedValues()
      Retrieves a list of allowed values for the current parameter, if available. If no allowed values are defined, returns an empty list.
      Returns:
      a list of allowed values of type T, or an empty list if no allowed values are defined
